div.l: And cam a gayn / and gan hire cradel mysse
And groped here and there / but sheo fonde noon
Allas quod she / I hadde almost mbysgonbysgonmysgon
I hadde almost goon / to the clerkys bed
Ey benedicite / thanne hadde I foule I sped
And forth she goth / til she the cradel fond
She gropeth alway / forther with her hond
And fonde the bedde / and thought nat but good
By cause that the cradel by it stooode s ode stoode
div.note: Hand 1 supplied the interlinear "o" as a correction; then Hand 2 erased the correction and overwrote the original with "to."
div.l: And nyste where she was / for it was derke
But faire and wele / she crepe In bi the clerke
And lieth ful stille / and wolde han kaught an sleep
With Inne a while / this Iohn the clerk vp leep

And on this good wife / he lheythheythleyth on sore The scribe seems to have begun to write "h" but stopped before completing his usual diagonal downstroke to the left; he then wrote the "e" over part of the "h" stroke.
So mury a fitte ne hadde she nat full yore
He priketh harde and depe / as he were mad
This Ioly lyfe han these two clerkys had
Til that the thrid cok bygan to synge
Aleyn waxe wery in the dawenynge
For he hadde swonken al the longe nyght
And seide farewele Malyn swete wight
The day is come I may no lenger byde
But euÌ‰er mo / wher so I goo or ride
I is thyn awen clerke so haue I sele
Now dere leman quod she / go fare welee welewele
But er thow goo / o thyng I wil the tellele telletelle
Whan that thow wendist hom ward by the melle
Ryght at the entre of the dore byhynde
Thow shalt a Cake of halfe a busshel y fynde
That was y maked of thyn owne mele
Whiche that I helpe / my sire for to stele
And good leman god the saue and kepe
And with that worde almost she gan to wepe
Aleyn vprist / and thought er that it dawe
I wole goo crepen In / be my felawe
And fonde the cradel with his hond a non
By god thought he al wronge / I haue mysgon
Myn heed is toty / of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me / that I goo nat right
I woot wele by the cradel / I haue mysgo
